{"step_by_step_thinking": "Aminophylline is a bronchodilator used for treating symptoms of asthma, chronic bronchitis, and other lung diseases. Epinephrine is used in emergencies to treat very serious allergic reactions to insect stings/bites, foods, drugs, etc. Atropine sulphate is used to help treat some types of slow heart rate and to decrease saliva production during surgery. Amoxycillin is an antibiotic used to treat a number of bacterial infections. Therefore, the odd one out in the context of anaesthetic emergencies is the one that is not used in such situations.", "answer_choice": "D. Amoxycillin"}
